title: Theo Walcott turns the tide for Everton as Mason Holgate and Richarlison give Marco Silva breathing space
text:
Everton 2 Watford 0

With respect to Theo Walcott, he is a most unlikely cure for Everton's erratic season given a career in which he has mastered inconsistency.

Yet for the second consecutive home game the ex-England winger made the difference, this time as a second-half substitute injecting purpose and energy into a previously drab game as his side took their quarter-final place at Watford’s expense. Much more of this and Walcott will rebuild his reputation.

Mason Holgate and Richarlison struck the second-half goals but Walcott was the catalyst for improvement after replacing the ineffective Moise Kean at half-time.

“He made a big impact again,” said Everton manager, Marco Silva.

“The change we made at half-time and the way we built our attacks was faster and gaps more clear.

“Theo was always important for me even if he was not sometimes playing or starting, He knows that. He got his chance in the last game because he deserved it. He is in a very good moment.”
